prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a triangular cutout Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0025, and 0.0. Create a new sketch and draw a rectangle on the XY plane. The rectangle should have a width of 0.75 and a height of 0.65. Divide the rectangle into two parts by drawing a line from the point (0.75, 0) to the point (0.75, 0.65). Now, create a triangle that fits into the remaining space of the rectangle. The triangle should have a base with a length of 0.75 and a height of 0.65. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0025 units. Part 2: CAD model with a simple geometric shape and no additional features Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and the translation vector to 0.1083, 0.0, and 0.0833. Create a new sketch and draw a rectangle on the XY plane. The rectangle should have a width of 0.2333 and a height of 0.4833. Create another rectangle that is offset from the first rectangle by 0.3 units in the X direction. The second rectangle should have a width of 0.2333 and a height of 0.4833. Create a third rectangle that is offset from the second rectangle by 0.3 units in the X direction. The third rectangle should have a width of 0.2333 and a height of 0.4833. Create a fourth rectangle that is offset from the third rectangle by 0.3 units in the X direction. The fourth rectangle should have a width of 0.2333 and a height of 0.4833. Extrude the four rectangles along the Z-axis by 0.0042 units, in the opposite direction of the normal. The final CAD model will be a simple geometric shape, resembling a stylized window or door frame, with a flat top and bottom and a slightly angled side. The shape will be composed of two parts: a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces (part 1), and a CAD model with no additional features (part 2). Part 1 will have a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.0025 units, and a height of 0.75 units. Part 2 will have a length of 0.5333 units, a width of 0.0042 units, and a height of 0.5333 units. The final CAD model will have a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.0025 units, and a height of 0.7833 units.</description>
